application.ref: GROBID - A machine learning software for extracting information from scholarly documents

titleStmt.title: English Alphabet Recognition with Telephone Speech

affiliation.orgName: Center for Spoken Language Understanding Oregon Graduate Institute of Science and Technology
Center for Spoken Language Understanding Oregon Graduate Institute of Science and Technology
Center for Spoken Language Understanding Oregon Graduate Institute of Science and Technology

analytic.title: English Alphabet Recognition with Telephone Speech

abstract.p: A recognition system is reported which recognizes names spelled over the telephone with brief pauses between letters. The system uses separate neural networks to locate segment boundaries and classify letters. The letter scores are then used to search a database of names to find the best scoring name. The speaker-independent classification rate for spoken letters is 89%. The system retrieves the correct name, spelled with pauses between letters, 91 % of the time from a database of 50,000 names.
